title: Brahmaputra River
summary: The Brahmaputra (/ˌbrɑːməˈpuːtrə/), also known as the Yarlung Tsangpo in Tibet, the Siang/Dihang River in Arunachal Pradesh, and Luit, Dilao[3] in Assam, is a trans-boundary river which flows through Tibet, India, and Bangladesh.[lower-alpha 1] It is the 9th largest river in the world by discharge, and the 15th longest.
